programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan. When Sam Baldwin's wife dies, he is left to bring up his eight-year-old son Jonah alone, and decides to move to Seattle to make a new start. On Christmas Eve, Jonah rings a radio phone-in with his Christmas wish to find a new wife for his dad. Meanwhile in Baltimore, journalist Annie Reed, who is having doubts about her own relationship, is listening in Nora Ephron - Director Tom Hanks - Sam Baldwin Meg Ryan - Annie Reed Ross Malinger - Jonah Baldwin Rosie O'Donnell - Becky Rob Reiner - Jay Bill Pullman - Walter Rita Wilson - Suzy Victor Garber - Greg Tom Riis Farrell - Rob Carey Lowell - Maggie Baldwin Le Clanche Du Rand - Barbara Reed Kevin O'Morrison - Cliff Reed David Hyde Pierce - Dennis Reed Tom Hanks - Sam Baldwin Meg Ryan - Annie Reed Ross Malinger - Jonah Baldwin Rosie O'Donnell - Becky Rob Reiner - Jay Bill Pullman - Walter Rita Wilson - Suzy Victor Garber - Greg Tom Riis Farrell - Rob Carey Lowell - Maggie Baldwin Le Clanche Du Rand - Barbara Reed Kevin O'Morrison - Cliff Reed David Hyde Pierce - Dennis Reed.

programme.title: Friends with Benefits
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis. When executive recruiter Jamie convinces LA-based art director Dylan to relocate to the Big Apple, the pair become friends. But having both been through the relationship mill, they are determined not to follow the cosy ways of Hollywood rom-coms and embark on a sex-only relationship. Then Jamie decides she wants to return to dating Will Gluck - Director Justin Timberlake - Dylan Mila Kunis - Jamie Woody Harrelson - Tommy Richard Jenkins - Mr Harper Patricia Clarkson - Lorna Jenna Elfman - Annie Bryan Greenberg - Parker Emma Stone - Kayla Justin Timberlake - Dylan Mila Kunis - Jamie Woody Harrelson - Tommy Richard Jenkins - Mr Harper Patricia Clarkson - Lorna Jenna Elfman - Annie Bryan Greenberg - Parker Emma Stone - Kayla.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Jan 2025

programme.title: The Cinema List: Musicals
programme.desc: It is time to get musical with this all-singing, all-dancing list of movies. From Wonka to La La Land, get ready to tap your feet along to the beat.

programme.title: Just Like Heaven
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Reese Witherspoon and Mark Ruffalo. After a fatal road accident, workaholic doctor Elizabeth Masterson wakes up in her own San Francisco apartment as a ghost, and resents the presence of its troubled new tenant David. But the pair may have far more in common than they think.. programme.title: Philadelphia
programme.desc: Drama starring Tom Hanks, Denzel Washington and Jason Robards. Andrew Beckett's career at a prestigious law firm appears to be taking off. programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Tom Hanks, Geena Davis, Lori Petty and Madonna. During the Second World War, with many American baseball players away on active service, a league of all-women teams is formed to satisfy demand for the sport. programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jude Law and Jack Black. After breaking up with her boyfriend, Los Angeles workaholic Amanda is in need of a holiday. An online search persuades her to exchange her California home over Christmas for the remote Surrey cottage of journalist Iris, who has just found out her ex is getting married. programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: Oscar-winning comedy drama starring Tom Hanks, Gary Sinise and Robin Wright. Forrest Gump wasn't born with a lot of smarts, but he is encouraged by his mother to realise his full potential. He attends college on a sports scholarship, meeting President Kennedy in the process, joins the army and is sent to Vietnam. programme.title: Saving Private Ryan

programme.title: Dunkirk

programme.title: Jarhead
programme.desc: War drama based on Anthony Swofford's memoir about his experiences as a marine sniper in the first Gulf War. Young recruit Swofford (Jake Gyllenhaal) impresses Staff Sgt Sykes (Jamie Foxx) during basic training and is invited to join his team where he is partnered with Troy (Peter Sarsgaard). They head to Saudi Arabia to fight but the heat of the desert and the long wait for battle pushes many of the marines to the brink of insanity Sam Mendes - Director Jake Gyllenhaal - Anthony \Swoff\ Swofford Jamie Foxx - Staff Sergeant Sykes Peter Sarsgaard - Allen Troy Chris Cooper - Lieutenant Colonel Kazinski Lucas Black - Chris Kruger Brian Geraghty - Fergus O'Donnell Jacob Vargas - Cortez Evan Jones - Fowler Laz Alonso - Escobar Dennis Haysbert - Major Lincoln Katherine Randolph - Young Mrs Swofford Jake Gyllenhaal - Anthony \Swoff\ Swofford Jamie Foxx - Staff Sergeant Sykes Peter Sarsgaard - Allen Troy Chris Cooper - Lieutenant Colonel Kazinski Lucas Black - Chris Kruger Brian Geraghty - Fergus O'Donnell Jacob Vargas - Cortez Evan Jones - Fowler Laz Alonso - Escobar Dennis Haysbert - Major Lincoln Katherine Randolph - Young Mrs Swofford.

programme.title: Oppenheimer

programme.title: In the Line of Fire
programme.desc: Thriller starring Clint Eastwood, John Malkovich and Rene Russo. programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Biographical comedy drama starring Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts and Philip Seymour Hoffman. In 1980s Washington, charismatic Texas politician Charles Wilson is notorious for his hard-drinking, drug-taking and womanising lifestyle, earning the nickname "Good Time Charlie". But the seemingly carefree congressman is stirred into action when socialite Joanne Herring draws his attention to the plight of the Afghan people suffering under Soviet occupation. With the help of a renegade CIA agent, he sets out to raise cash for the resistance fighters Mike Nichols - Director Tom Hanks - Charlie Wilson Julia Roberts - Joanne Herring Philip Seymour Hoffman - Gust Avrakotos Amy Adams - Bonnie Bach Emily Blunt - Jane Liddle Ken Stott - Zvi Om Puri - President Zia Ned Beatty - Doc Long Shiri Appleby - Charlie's Angel.

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Biographical comedy drama starring Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts and Philip Seymour Hoffman. In 1980s Washington, charismatic Texas politician Charles Wilson is notorious for his hard-drinking, drug-taking and womanising lifestyle, earning the nickname "Good Time Charlie". But the seemingly carefree congressman is stirred into action when socialite Joanne Herring draws his attention to the plight of the Afghan people suffering under Soviet occupation. programme.title: Suzann Pettersen: Her Final Putt

programme.title: The Greatest Solheim

programme.title: Women's Open 2024 Highlights

programme.title: Solheim Cup 2024 Highlights
programme.desc: On the final day of the Solheim Cup, Robert Trent Jones Golf Club is set for a thrilling finale. Team Europe look to mount a comeback as they trail USA 10-6 ahead of the singles. (15.09).

programme.title: The Best of The 2024 PGA Tour
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from The Sentry - forming part of the 2024 PGA Tour season - held at the Plantation Course. The Masters champion Jon Rahm was the last winner here in 2023.

programme.title: The Best of The 2024 PGA Tour
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2024 AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am, one of eight PGA Tour Signature Events this season, taking place across two iconic courses - Pebble Beach and Spyglass Hill.

programme.title: The Best of The 2024 PGA Tour
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the Genesis Invitational - the third PGA Tour Signature Event of 2024 - at Riviera Country Club in California. Jon Rahm claimed victory here previously.

programme.title: The Best of The 2024 PGA Tour
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2024 Arnold Palmer Invitational, a PGA Tour Signature event held at Bay Hill in Florida. Kurt Kitayama was the last man to taste victory here.

programme.title: The Best of The 2024 PGA Tour
programme.desc: Day four of the Players Championship, taking place at TPC Sawgrass in Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida. Who will follow Scottie Scheffler to scoop the PGA Tour's richest prize in 2024? (17.03).

programme.title: The Best of The 2024 PGA Tour
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2024 RBC Heritage, held at Harbour Town Golf Links in South Carolina. England's Matt Fitzpatrick claimed play-off victory here a year ago.

programme.title: The Best of The 2024 PGA Tour
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2024 Wells Fargo Championship, held at Quail Hollow Club in Charlotte, North Carolina. Wyndham Clark scooped the $3,600,000 prize pot last year.

programme.title: The Best of The 2024 PGA Tour
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2024 RBC Canadian Open - a PGA Tour event staged in Ontario at Hamilton Golf and Country Club. Victory belonged to home favourite Nick Taylor last year.

programme.title: The Best of The 2024 PGA Tour
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the PGA Tour's Memorial Tournament, held at Muirfield Village Golf Club in Dublin, Ohio. 2023 winner Viktor Hovland returns to defend the title.

programme.title: The Best of The 2024 PGA Tour
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2024 Travelers Championship from TPC River Highlands in Cromwell, Connecticut. Victory belonged to Keegan Bradley at this PGA Tour event a year ago.

programme.title: Scottie: 24
programme.desc: A look at Scottie Scheffler's remarkable 2024 campaign.

programme.title: PGA Tour: The Cut
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes of the PGA Tour. Follow the world's best players as they prepare for the big events in 2025.

programme.desc: This special Lifeblood short follows United's trailblazing Under-19s side as they break new ground and represent the club on uncharted territory in Lithuania in the UEFA Youth League.

programme.title: The Impossible Dream
programme.desc: 20 years on, Manchester United's 1998/99 season remains the greatest campaign in English football history. In this documentary, those involved reveal how the Reds achieved the impossible Treble.

programme.desc: This special short in our Lifeblood series takes us to Hong Kong as our U16s take part in the latest Youth Football Academy Summit in a festival of cultural and football exchange.

programme.desc: Highlights of the Emirates FA Cup quarter-final against Liverpool.

programme.title: Official Utd Podcast - Mark Hughes
programme.desc: Sparky walks us through his many successful years at Old Trafford and the thinking behind his decision to manage Man City years later.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Diogo Dalot Part 2
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Diogo Dalot. He's back to talk about his impressive rise to regular first team player.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Owen Hargreaves
programme.desc: Owen looked back on his time working with Sir Alex Ferguson, what went through his head before taking a penalty in the 2008 Champions League Final shootout and the details of his career-ending injury.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Ander Herrera
programme.desc: UTD Podcast co-hosts Helen Evans and Sam Homewood travelled to Bilbao, Spain, to catch up with Ander Herrera, whose honesty and passion led to one of our best-ever episodes.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Fraizer Campbell
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with academy graduate, Fraizer Campbell. He talks about the ups and downs of his career and his pivotal decision in the dramatic deadline-day Dimitar Berbatov deal.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Gordon Strachan
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with former United winger Gordon Strachan. We cover it all, from the early days at Dundee, to enjoying success home and away under Sir Alex Ferguson at Aberdeen FC.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Ella Toone
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Ella Toone. A devoted fan growing up, her dream of playing for the Reds seemed impossible but the inception of the women's side in 2018 changed all that.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Christian Eriksen
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Christian Eriksen. He addresses the obstacles he has overcome and explains why he left Italy, swapping Inter Milan for a return to the Premier League.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Steve Bruce
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Steve Bruce. Not only did he star for the Reds as a team won our first title for 26 years but he also became club captain.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Eric Steele
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Eric Steele. The Reds' former goalkeeping coach lifts the lid on his time at the club.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Marc Skinner
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Marc Skinner who reflects back on an incredible season for our women's team.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Daley Blind
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Daley Blind talking about a wide range of subjects, including his stint at Old Trafford and the pressure to perform.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Kevin Moran
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Kevin Moran, centre back for United from 1978 to 1988 and two times FA Cup winner!

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Pat McGibbon
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Pat McGibbon who shares advice on coping with mental health issues and retirement from football.

programme.title: UTD Podcast: Memories unite us: By Cad
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast, in collaboration with Cadbury, for a trip down memory lane.

programme.title: UTD Podcast: Youth Voice with Wes Brow
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast. Wes Brown is joined by Manchester United Foundation's 'Youth Voice' group to talk about issues important to them.

programme.title: UTD Podcast: Gary Neville
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with class of '92 graduate, treble winner and former club captain, Gary Neville.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Keith Hacke
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with former referee and general manager of the PGMOL, Keith Hackett.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Paul McGuinness
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with former academy coach Paul McGuinness who shares stories about his farther Wilf and Uncle Bobby.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Jimmy Nicholl
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with defensive stalwart Jimmy Nicholl, telling some riveting stories from his time at United between 1975 and 1981.

programme.title: PL: United v Man City 94/95
programme.desc: United Archives 10/11/94. A classic derby encounter as Brian Horton brought his team across the city to Old Trafford.

programme.title: PL: United v Ipswich 94/95
programme.desc: United Archives 4/3/95. An amazing goal-fest at the Theatre of Dreams in March 95 as Andy Cole scored five times in an historic 9-0 victory over Ipswich Town.

programme.title: PL: United v Man City 94/95
programme.desc: United Archives 10/11/94. A classic derby encounter as Brian Horton brought his team across the city to Old Trafford.

programme.title: PL: United v Ipswich 94/95
programme.desc: United Archives 4/3/95. An amazing goal-fest at the Theatre of Dreams in March 95 as Andy Cole scored five times in an historic 9-0 victory over Ipswich Town.

programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/96. With a huge trip to Newcastle looming, United looked to keep the pressure on at the top by beating struggling Bolton.

programme.desc: United Archives 28/4/96. United ended their home campaign against Nottingham Forest, knowing that a win would take them to the brink of the Premiership title.

programme.desc: United Archives 5/9/00. United battered the Bantams in impressive style with Teddy Sheringham and Quinton Fortune hitting a brace each.

programme.desc: United Archives 28/10/00. United welcomed struggling Southampton looking to keep up their scintillating home form, having scored 22 goals in their opening six league contests at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/01. United welcomed Arsenal knowing that victory would move them closer to securing a third consecutive Premiership crown.

programme.title: PL: United v Blackburn 10/11
programme.desc: United Archives 27/11/10. The Reds looked to make it 20 Premier League games unbeaten as they welcomed Big Sam's Blackburn to Old Trafford.

programme.desc: Presenting United's greatest goals from the first 200 European games played at Old Trafford.

programme.desc: We revisit the 2002/03 UEFA Champions League final between Juventus and AC Milan at Old Trafford. Paolo Maldini aimed to lift the trophy as captain, just as his father did in 1963.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2004
programme.desc: We revisit the 2003/04 UEFA Champions League final between Monaco and Porto in Gelsenkirchen. Jose Mourinho would leave Porto to take over at Chelsea just days later.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2007
programme.desc: We rewind back to the 2006/07 UEFA Champions League final at the Olympic Stadium in Athens as AC Milan looked to avenge their defeat two years previously against the Reds.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2009
programme.desc: A look back at the 2009 UEFA Champions League final between Barcelona and Man Utd in Rome. United were bidding to become the first team to defend the trophy in the modern era.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2010
programme.desc: We revisit the 2010 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Inter Milan at the Bernabeu. Jose Mourinho was looking to become the third man to win it with two clubs.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2013
programme.desc: We revisit the all-German 2013 UEFA Champions League final between Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich at Wembley. Bayern had lost two finals in three years.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2015
programme.desc: We revisit the enthralling 2014/15 UEFA Champions League final between Juventus and Barcelona in Berlin. Barcelona were chasing their third Champions League title in six years.

programme.title: Barcelona v Man Utd 1994/95
programme.desc: We revisit the 1994/95 UEFA Champions League group stage tie between Barcelona and Man Utd at the Nou Camp. Johan Cruyff's 'Dream Team' featured Hristo Stoichkov and Romario.

programme.title: Man Utd v Barcelona 1998/99
programme.desc: We revisit the 1998/99 UEFA Champions League group stage epic between Man Utd and Barcelona at Old Trafford. This end-to-end game featured six goals, two penalties and a red card.

programme.title: Arsenal v Bayer Leverkusen 2001/02
programme.desc: We revisit the thrilling 2001/02 UEFA Champions League group stage clash between Arsenal and Bayer Leverkusen at Highbury. A tough group also included Deportivo and Juventus.

programme.title: Man Utd v Real Madrid 2002/03
programme.desc: We revisit the 2002/03 UEFA Champions League quarter-final second leg between Manchester United and Real Madrid at Old Trafford. A star-studded Madrid side won the first leg 3-1.

programme.title: Monaco v Deportivo 2003/04
programme.desc: We revisit the epic 2003/04 UEFA Champions League group stage clash between Monaco and Deportivo at the Stade Louis II, featuring 11 goals in total, with one player scoring four.

programme.title: Man Utd v Rangers 2003/04
programme.desc: We revisit the 2003/04 'Battle of Britain' UEFA Champions League group stage tie between Man Utd and Rangers at Old Trafford. Victory for United would almost seal a knockout spot.

programme.title: Lazio v Chelsea 2003/04
programme.desc: We revisit the 2003/04 UEFA Champions League group stage tie between Lazio and Chelsea at the Stadio Olimpico. The clash was marred by the behaviour of Lazio's Sinisa Mihajlovic.

programme.title: Manchester United v Porto 2003/04
programme.desc: We revisit the 2003/04 UEFA Champions League last 16 second leg between Man Utd and Jose Mourinho's Porto at Old Trafford. United lost the first leg 2-1, with Roy Keane seeing red.

programme.title: Liverpool v Olympiakos 2004/05
programme.desc: We revisit the extraordinary 2004/05 UEFA Champions League group stage tie between Liverpool and Olympiakos at Anfield. Rafael Benitez's men needed to win by two goals to progress.

programme.title: Chelsea v Porto 2004/05
programme.desc: We revisit the 2004/05 UEFA Champions League group stage tie between Chelsea and Porto at Stamford Bridge. Jose Mourinho faced the side he led to European glory the previous term.

programme.title: Chelsea v Bayern Munich 2004/05
programme.desc: We revisit the 2004/05 UEFA Champions League quarter-final first leg between Chelsea and Bayern Munich at Stamford Bridge. Frank Lampard inspired the Blues to an impressive win.

programme.title: Liverpool v Juventus 2004/05
programme.desc: We revisit the 2004/05 UEFA Champions League quarter-final first leg between Liverpool and Juventus at Anfield, the first game between the sides since the 1985 Heysel disaster.

programme.title: Liverpool v Chelsea 2004/05
programme.desc: We revisit the dramatic 2004/05 UEFA Champions League semi-final second leg between Liverpool and Chelsea at Anfield. The tie was finely poised after the first leg finished 0-0.

programme.desc: We revisit the 2006/07 UEFA Champions League group stage tie between Celtic and Man Utd at Parkhead. A win for Celtic would guarantee a place in the knockouts for the first time.

programme.title: Arsenal v Slavia Prague 2007/08
programme.desc: We revisit the entertaining 2007/08 UEFA Champions League group stage tie between Arsenal and Slavia Prague at the Emirates. The Gunners had not lost at home in Europe since 2004.

programme.title: Man Utd v Barcelona 2007/08
programme.desc: We revisit the 2007/08 UEFA Champions League semi-final second leg between Man Utd and Barcelona at Old Trafford. The tie was delicately poised after a 0-0 draw in the first leg.
